content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron ore mining and smelting structure at position around (17.5, 72.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
- Electric mining drill at position (17.5, 72.5) facing down, currently powered but output blocked due to furnace belt blockage.
- Stone furnace at position (18.0, 75.0) used for smelting iron ore, fueled with coal, currently working but with full output inventory.
- Two wooden chests at positions (19.5, 75.5) and (21.5, 75.5), serving as storage for smelted iron plates.
- Additional wooden chest at (21.5, 77.5) placed to receive iron plates, with a burner inserter at (20.5, 77.5) fueled and operational, moving iron plates into it.
- Burner inserter at (20.5, 75.5) fueled with coal, moving iron plates from furnace to first chest.
- Small electric pole at (15.5, 75.5) connected to power network.
- Output blockage warning at furnace belt drop position affecting mining drill operation persists despite inventory management.

This structure enables extraction, smelting, and staged storage of iron plates with improved inserter fuel management and power connectivity, though output belt blockage remains unresolved.

### Steam power generation structure at position around (-9.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at position (-9.5, -0.5) extracting water.
- Boiler at position (-5.0, 2.5) fueled with coal, currently working.
- Steam engine at position (0.5, 6.5) connected to boiler by pipes, currently working and generating power.
- Small electric poles near boiler (-4.5, -0.5), steam engine (0.5, 3.5), and newly connected pole at (8.95, 13.05) ensuring full power network connectivity.

This structure reliably generates electricity from steam power, supplying the factory’s electric network.

### Iron gear wheel assembly structure at position around (25.5, 80.5)
Consists of:
- Assembling machine 2 placed at (25.5, 80.5), connected to power network, but currently idle due to missing iron plate inputs.
- Input burner inserter at (20.5, 77.5) feeding into the assembly area, fueled and operational.
- Output burner inserter at (25.5, 83.5), fueled and placed after removal of previous wooden chest at (25.5, 82.5).
- New wooden chest at (25.5, 82.5) placed as output storage for assembling machine.
- Small electric pole placed near assembler at (25.5, 77.5), connected to power network.

This structure is set up for iron gear wheel production with proper power and inserter fuel, but lacks sufficient iron plate input to commence crafting.

ERROR TIPS

### Entity placement conflicts due to occupied tiles
- Previous failures to place electric poles and burner inserters due to occupied tiles have been resolved by removing obstructing wooden chest and repositioning inserters.
- Always verify tile occupancy before placing entities; removing or relocating existing entities can free necessary space.

### Inserter fuel and inventory management
- Burner inserters at (20.5, 77.5) and (25.5, 83.5) were initially out of fuel or unpowered but are now fueled and operational.
- Ensure continuous fueling of burner inserters to maintain operation.
- Avoid overfilling inserter inventories by managing input/output chest inventories and inserter throughput.

### Crafting and recipe input shortages
- Assembling machine 2 at (25.5, 80.5) remains idle due to missing iron plates despite power connectivity and inserter setup.
- To enable crafting, ensure sufficient iron plate supply is delivered to the assembling machine input chest.
- Monitor assembling machine input inventories and manage upstream iron plate flow accordingly.

### Output blockage and power connectivity warnings
- The mining drill at (17.5, 72.5) still reports furnace belt blockage and furnace output inventory full warnings, limiting throughput.
- Clear output belts and chests downstream of furnace to prevent blockage.
- Maintain power network connectivity as done with new poles near assembling machine and steam engine to ensure all machines operate.

NAMESPACE
No user-defined functions have been defined by the agent
